comments:
1. Start with a new workspace with large log support for cloudscape 10.0GA 
embedded mode.
2. Import the scenarioOne HTTP access and error log files.   
3. Close the workbench.   
4. Delete the workspace, so that we use a new workspace when we reload the 
workbench.   
5. Reload the workbench.   
6. Enable large log support with the same database.   
7. Import the scenarioOne HTTP access log file.  

When I imported, it initially was blank.  However I double clicked on the log 
and it opened okay.  I did get the following exception however in the .log file:

This also occured in cloudscape 5.1.  It occured however on the first import of 
a log file.  So perhaps the extra steps of closing a workbench and deleting are 
unnecessary.  Simply setting up the database in embedded mode and importing a 
log file produces this error.
Same issue in Cloudscape 10.1, embedded mode.

Upgrading to critical because it's failing test case "Import after workspace
delete" in test suite "Platform.UI.LargeLogSupport".

Since this problem occurs in the large resource support code I am transfering 
the defect to you Marius as discussed. Please check in the fix.

Since this is a Platform bug, I am changing it to a Platform component.  Please 
change the component if Platform.Model is not correct.

It was negotiated in the Planning Group meeting that this defect is a lower 
severity since the functionality works.  The problem should be fixed before 4.1 
GA so I made it P1 priority but dropped the severity to normal.  If a fix 
cannot be found for iteration 1, the defect can be deferred to iteration 1.
